title: Solutions
description: Who are you, and who are you looking to reach?

item.title: Manufacturing
item.subtitle: Caption: Engraving of Victorian craftsmen blowing glass at Whitefrairs Glass Works, 18th Century.
item.alt: Caption: Engraving of Victorian craftsmen blowing glass at Whitefrairs Glass Works, 18th Century.
item.listcontent: A tradition of fine craftsmanship - this is your heritage. The export markets of the 21st century - how will your modern craftsmen reach them?

item.title: Services
item.subtitle: Caption: Engraving of a Victorian classroom, with a boy in a dunce's cap standing behind the blackboard, Leisure Hour, 1872.
item.alt: Caption: Engraving of a Victorian classroom, with a boy in a dunce's cap standing behind the blackboard, Leisure Hour, 1872.
item.listcontent: Educators have moved on from corporal punishments and dunce caps. Do your students understand what you are saying, and have you really moved on?

item.title: Tourism
item.subtitle: Caption: Illustration of men travelling by train in Victorian India; from 'Rip Van Winkle's Travels in Africa & Asia'; published by Thomas Crowell & Co., New York, 1882.
item.alt: Caption: Illustration of men travelling by train in Victorian India; from 'Rip Van Winkle's Travels in Africa & Asia'; published by Thomas Crowell & Co., New York, 1882.
item.listcontent: Your customers are from a different place, and if they don't think in the same language as you, a different linguistic reality. What are their expectations?
